Class ChronicleConfig

    public class ChronicleConfig
extends Object
implements Cloneable
    Author:
    peter.lawrey

    • Field Detail

      • SMALL

        public static final ChronicleConfig SMALL
        A pre-defined ChronicleConfig for small Chronicle instances. It has the following params:
        • data block size 16M
        • index file capacity 4K
        • index file excerpts 2M
        • minimise footprint true

      • MEDIUM

        public static final ChronicleConfig MEDIUM
        A pre-defined ChronicleConfig for medium Chronicle instances. It has the following params:
        • data block size 128M
        • index file capacity 16K
        • index file excerpts 16M
        • minimise footprint false

      • LARGE

        public static final ChronicleConfig LARGE
        A pre-defined ChronicleConfig for large Chronicle instances. It has the following params:
        • data block size 512M
        • index file capacity 64K
        • index file excerpts 64M
        • minimise footprint false

      • HUGE

        public static final ChronicleConfig HUGE
        A pre-defined ChronicleConfig for huge Chronicle instances. It has the following params:
        • data block size 512M
        • index file capacity 4M
        • index file excerpts 256M
        • minimise footprint false

      • TEST

        public static final ChronicleConfig TEST
        A pre-defined ChronicleConfig for test Chronicle instances. It has the following params:
        • data block size 8K
        • index file capacity 1M
        • index file excerpts 8K
        • minimise footprint true

      • DEFAULT

        public static final ChronicleConfig DEFAULT
        The default ChronicleConfig used by various Chronicle implementations if not otherwise specified. On 64 bit JVMs it delegates to MEDIUM, on 32 bit ones to SMALL.

    • Method Detail

      • indexFileCapacity

        public ChronicleConfig indexFileCapacity(int indexFileCapacity)
        Sets the capacity to be used for index files. This parameter is used only in net.openhft.chronicle.sandbox.RollingChronicle.
        Parameters:
        indexFileCapacity - the capacity to be used for index files
        Returns:
        the same instance of ChronicleConfig that the method was called upon

        the capacity to be used for index files

      • minimiseFootprint

        public void minimiseFootprint(boolean minimiseFootprint)
        Sets a flag specifying if the footprint of the backing files should be kept to a minimum or not. This parameter isn't used by any Chronicle implementations.
        Parameters:
        minimiseFootprint - if the footprint should be kept to a minimum or not

      • minimiseFootprint

        public boolean minimiseFootprint()
        Returns the flag specifying if the footprint of the backing files should be kept to a minimum or not. This parameter isn't used by any Chronicle implementations.
        Returns:
        the flag specifying if the footprint of the backing files should be kept to a minimum or not

      • useUnsafe

        public ChronicleConfig useUnsafe(boolean useUnsafe)
        Specifies if Unsafe should be used by the Chronicle instance being configured. Defaults to false. This parameter is not used by any Chronicle implementations.
        Parameters:
        useUnsafe - the flag specifying if Unsafe should be used or not
        Returns:
        the same instance of ChronicleConfig that the method was called upon

      • useUnsafe

        public boolean useUnsafe()
        Returns the flag specifying if Unsafe should be used by the Chronicle instance being configured. Defaults to false. This parameter is not used by any Chronicle implementations.
        Returns:
        the flag specifying if Unsafe should be used or not

      • synchronousMode

        public ChronicleConfig synchronousMode(boolean synchronousMode)
        Sets the synchronous mode to be used. Enabling synchronous mode means that ExcerptCommon.finish() will force a persistence every time.
        Parameters:
        synchronousMode - If synchronous mode should be used or not.
        Returns:
        the same instance of ChronicleConfig that the method was called upon

      • synchronousMode

        public boolean synchronousMode()
        Checks if synchronous mode is enabled or not.
        Returns:
        true if synchronous mode is enabled, false otherwise.

      • byteOrder

        public ChronicleConfig byteOrder(ByteOrder byteOrder)
        Sets the byte order to be used when serializing into/from the backing files. Defaults to native order.
        Parameters:
        byteOrder - the byte order to be used when serializing (big endian, little endian and such)
        Returns:
        the same instance of ChronicleConfig that the method was called upon

      • byteOrder

        public ByteOrder byteOrder()
        Returns the byte order being used when serializing (into/from the backing files). Defaults to native order.
        Returns:
        the byte order used when serializing

      • cacheLineSize

        public ChronicleConfig cacheLineSize(int cacheLineSize)
        Sets the size of the index cache lines. Index caches (files) consist of fixed size lines, each line having multiple index entries on it. This param specifies the size of such a multi entry line. Default value is 64.
        Parameters:
        cacheLineSize - the size of the cache lines making up index files
        Returns:
        the same instance of ChronicleConfig that the method was called upon

      • cacheLineSize

        public int cacheLineSize()
        The size of the index cache lines (index caches are made up of multiple fixed length lines, each line contains multiple index entries). Default value is 64.
        Returns:
        the size of the index cache lines

      • dataBlockSize

        public ChronicleConfig dataBlockSize(int dataBlockSize)
        Sets the size to be used for data blocks. The method also has a side effect. If the data block size specified is smaller than twice the message capacity, then the message capacity will be adjusted to equal half of the new data block size.
        Parameters:
        dataBlockSize - the size of the data blocks
        Returns:
        the same instance of ChronicleConfig that the method was called upon

      • dataBlockSize

        public int dataBlockSize()
        Returns the size of the data blocks.
        Returns:
        the size of the data blocks

      • indexBlockSize

        public ChronicleConfig indexBlockSize(int indexBlockSize)
        Sets the size to be used for index blocks. Is capped to the bigger value among 4096 and a quarter of the data block size.
        Parameters:
        indexBlockSize - the size of the index blocks
        Returns:
        the same instance of ChronicleConfig that the method was called upon

      • indexBlockSize

        public int indexBlockSize()
        Returns the size of the index blocks.
        Returns:
        the size of the index blocks

      • messageCapacity

        public ChronicleConfig messageCapacity(int messageCapacity)
        The maximum size a message stored in a Chronicle instance can have. Defaults to 128K. Is limited by the data block size, can't be bigger than half of the data block size.
        Parameters:
        messageCapacity - the maximum message size that can be stored
        Returns:
        the same instance of ChronicleConfig that the method was called upon

      • messageCapacity

        public int messageCapacity()
        The maximum size of the message that can be stored in the Chronicle instance to be configured. Defaults to 128K. Can't be bigger than half of the data block size.
        Returns:
        the maximum message size that can be stored

        public boolean useCheckedExcerpt()

public ChronicleConfig clone()
